content: stash buster slippers by myjamma knits this is a great way to use up the extra yarn in your stash the slippers are made holding two strands of yarn together and working as one i often use one solid color yarn and one variegated or add stripes with whatever yarn available if i change colors i like to change only one strand at a time at the beginning of a right side row if i want my stripes to match i ll have two sets of needles going at once but you be you mix it up yarn worsted weight washable please these are slippers gage 5 stitches = 1 inch needles size 8 sizes toddler child - adult small - adult medium - adult large - adult xl approximate length of each size 5in 7in - 8in - 9in - 10in - 11in approximate amount of yarn need for each size 2oz 3oz - 4oz - 5oz - 6oz - 7oz begin at the back of the heel work both colors of yarn together as one cast on 26 29-32-35-38-44 stitches row 1 knit 8 9-10-11-12-14 purl 1 knit 8 9-10-11-12-14 purl 1 knit 8 9-10-11-12-14 wrong or inside of slipper row 2 knit all stitches right or outside of slipper repeat these two row until you have worked 28 40-50-56-60-64 row you will have half the number of ridges as you have row work in knit 1 purl 1 ribbing for 4 4-6-8-8-10 row right side knit 2 together repeat across the row child and adult medium have an odd number knit the last stitch alone you are pulling two strands of yarn through four strands this will be tight that s okay keeps your toes cozy wrong side purl all stitches repeat these two row until you have less than 10 stitches draw yarn through the final stitches and pull tight fold the slipper in half lengthwise sew together the toe and the top of the foot past the ribbing and 1/3 of the ridges sew the back of the slipper as a flat seam it will mold to your foot as you wear it make the second slipper add buttons bows pom poms or whatever to decorate or not
